{"step_by_step_thinking": "To determine the tumor marker for seminoma, we need to refer to the relevant documents. Document [9] mentions that a classical or pure seminoma does not cause an elevated serum alpha fetoprotein (AFP). Document [3] states that the lack of frequent tumor markers in the sera of patients with seminoma prompted a study on biochemical tumor markers, including placental alkaline phosphatase (PLAP), gamma-glutamyl transpeptidase (gamma GT), human chorionic gonadotropin (hCG), and alpha-fetoprotein (AFP).
